author: Staff Reporter
text:
First Additional District Judge M. Jothiraman sentenced a man to undergo life imprisonment for murdering a woman in 2007.

The prosecution case was that Kumar of Vidya Nagar in Ammapet, a bank employee, was married to Rajeswari (35). It was said that she had an illicit affair with G. Baskar (48) of VOC Nagar. On March 20, 2007, Baskar murdered Rajeswari and took away her jewellery.

He packed the body in a bag and threw it near a bridge in Panamarathupatty.

The Panamarathupatty police registered a case under Sections 302 (murder), 201 (causing disappearance of evidence) and 404 (dishonest misappropriation of property possessed by deceased person) of IPC.

It was transferred to Ammapet police.

The police arrested Baskar, his mother Dhanalakshmi and partner S. Ravi alias Ravichandran (47), who helped him in committing the crime.

The judge found them guilty and sentenced Baskar to life imprisonment and levied a fine of Rs. 16,000 on him, three years imprisonment and a fine of Rs. 15,000 for Ravichandran and three years and a fine of Rs. 10,000 for Dhanalakshmi.
title: Man gets life term for murder
